required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of New Feedback Canceller for Carina™ Implant
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of a New Feedback Canceller Algorithm for Patient With Moderate to Severe Hearing Loss Implanted With a Fully Implantable Carina™ Medical Device

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate audio quality benefit for the patient implanted with a Cochlear or Otologics Carina implant with the new firmware (feedback canceller algorithm) whatever the patient environment is and to evaluate the functional gain and speech understanding benefit for the patient upon the firmware used (new and reference firmware). The new firmware aims to adapt automatically for feedback cancellation without prior calibration.

primary_outcome.measure: Sound quality benefit assessed via subjective patient evaluation with Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit questionnaire
Sound quality benefit assessed via subjective patient evaluation with Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit questionnaire
Sound quality benefit assessed via subjective patient evaluation with Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit questionnaire
Sound quality benefit assessed via subjective patient evaluation with Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit questionnaire

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement in speech understanding assessed via speech audiometry in noise
Improvement in speech understanding assessed via speech audiometry in noise
Improvement in speech understanding assessed via speech audiometry in noise
Improvement in speech understanding assessed via speech audiometry in noise

intervention.description: The study consists of two phases. Phase 1: optimization of parameters of new feedback canceller algorithm. Phase 2: comparison of new and reference feedback canceller algorithms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- successfully implanted with a commercial available CE-labelled implant device, resulting in measurable open set speech understanding
- native speaker in the language used to assess their clinical performance, i.e. French
Exclusion Criteria:
- unwillingness or inability to comply with all of the investigational requirements
- additional handicaps that would prevent or restrict participation in the audiological evaluations
